span.style: display: block; text-align: right; cursor: pointer;

div.p:
Parents and students,
In response to the Governor’s recommendation to keep school buildings closed due to COVID-19, Lenoir City Schools will continue to provide instructional and meal services to students. While school buildings are closed, learning is not. Our school principals will be working with teachers to communicate information specific to your child’s learning plan. If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to our administrators who will provide assistance.
As we move into the last weeks of school, each school will set times for pick-up of school yearbooks, personal belongings, pictures, return of library books, and other items.
High school students including graduating seniors have been given opportunities to continue to improve their grades through May 8. Graduation is a priority for us and we will recognize our senior class of 2020 with a Graduation Ceremony. At this time, we are rescheduling graduation for Friday, July 31, 2020, provided it is safe to have large group meetings.
Lenoir City Schools website will be updated by Tuesday, April 21, to provide answers to questions as they are asked and decisions made. Thank you to parents who are working with us to help keep learning ongoing during this unusual time of disruption to school.
As a district we are working to make a plan for how to address student learning needs going forward. Again, feel free to contact your school with any questions.
Most sincerely,
Dr. Jeanne K. Barker
